intro: Merremia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces distinctive, pale yellow to orange flowers that open in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are covered in fine, soft hairs. Merremia palmeri thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
